repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Docs for treesitter would benefit from including more real-world and
practical examples of queries and usages, rather than hypothetical ones
(e.g. names such as "foo", "bar"). Improved examples should be more
user-friendly and clear to understand.

In addition, align the capture names in some examples with the actual
ones being used in the built-in query files or in the nvim-treesitter
plugin, e.g.:

- `@parameter` -> `@variable.parameter`
- `@comment.doc.java` -> `@comment.documentation.java`
- etc.

comment_data.body: Please keep that, it's added deliberately. (used in `vimdoc`).
Sorry, my bad I missed it's being used in vimdoc. I also removed all the colon in this block for consistency
Hmm I see, looking at CONTRIBUTING.md of nvim-treesitter the use of colon was intentional? (In `comment` what's highlighted is actually `NOTE` not `NOTE:` ---- But in vimdoc it's `NOTE:`)
Well, the colons _are_ captured ;) But I agree, that's not relevant here and looks better this way.

Yep, that's why I wrote above that removing colons for consistency is a good idea here ;)

(The important information here is what sort of keyword belongs in which severity, which is clear(er) without colon as well.)
Doesn't really matter in either way but I will choose the way to remove all the colons here for the consistency, as this will look least confusing to readers.
Yes, as I said, I agree ;)

comment_regular_data.body:
> Docs for treesitter would benefit from including more real-world and practical examples of queries and usages

They would profit from a lot of things... (For example, more guidance on writing queries, such as documenting pattern precedence etc.) We've punted writing a proper manual again and again (since treesitter support is still declared experimental).

That shouldn't block improvements like these, of course.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: docs(treesitter): add more examples, and improve consistency
